taskDescription:
Using natural numbers, multiples of 5 are given by the sequence <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>5, 10, 15, </mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>…<!-- … --></mo>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\{ {\text{5, 10, 15, }} \ldots \} </annotation></semantics></math>. Write this set using set builder notation by associating each multiple of 5 in terms of a natural number, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>n</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">n</annotation></semantics></math>.
detailedSolution:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">{</mo>
  <mi>m</mi>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo stretchy="false">|</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mi>m</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mi>n</mi>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> where </mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mi>n</mi>
  <mo>∈<!-- ∈ --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mi mathvariant="double-struck">N</mi>
  </mrow>
  <mo fence="false" stretchy="false">}</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\{ m|m = 5n{\text{ where }}n \in \mathbb{N}\}</annotation></semantics></math>
